page.title: 01Thornley and Knowle Green
page.content:
The area is North and North-east of Longridge, population 7,352, which provides most of the amenities for the area, although the villages of Chipping 2 km to the North and Ribchester 3km to the South also provide shops, churches and schools.
It includes the South-western end of Longridge Fell on the western edges of the Pennines rising from 91m to 286km; is a rural area with part of the hamlet of Knowle Green in its South-eastern corner. The land is farmed and much of that to the North, in Thornley, is owned by Bridgewater Estates. Some of the farmhouses have been sold and are now private dwellings; the land being joined to adjacent farms. Preston 10km South-west and Clitheroe 15km East North-east are the nearest towns.
